poem:
Title: Mistaken Identity

In Taylor Town, we thought we knew,
Two men, a switch, a spectral hue.
From Beatles' birth and football's glory,
A tale retold: wrong auricular story.
Across the Mersey, ferrymen sing,
Of Anfield's pride and Goodison's king,
But lost labours in life's rough pool,
Clear as truth; not Taylor, Liverpool.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Two men were switched at birth – and things only got weirder from there Have you ever been to Taylor Town? You know it: it’s the place the Beatles came from. The one where you can catch a ferry across the Mersey – home to iconic football stadiums Goodison Park and Anfield, the latter of which is played in by, I think, Taylorpool FC? Oh wait, no: it’s Liverpool, isn’t it? Frankly, you could be". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
